snippet: A new survey seems to hold some explanation for Donald Trump’s and Bernie Sanders’s popularity by appealing to angry Americans.
abstract: Editorial notes anger among Americans has fueled presidential campaigns of both Republican Donald J Trump and Democrat Bernie Sanders; argues while outrage is shared by both parties, only Sanders's promise to restore economic strength of middle class is viable path forward.
lead_paragraph: A new survey seems to hold some explanation for Donald Trump’s and Bernie Sanders’s popularity by appealing to angry Americans.
